circumstances:
The crew departed RAF Pembrey on a local training exercice. In the evening, while flying in the vicinity of the airbase, the airplane suffered an engine failure. The pilot-in-command attempted an emergency landing when the aircraft crashed in the Gwendraeth Marshes, less than two km north of the airfield. All four crew members were killed.
Crew:
P/O Basil York Sowter, pilot,
Sgt David Jack Blair, navigator,
Sgt John Douglas Laing Cooper, wireless operator and air gunner, 
Sgt George Warden Brown, wireless operator and air gunner.
